summary: This is an email chain from January 6, 2020, forwarding a notification from December 24, 2019, regarding the status of a subpoena for banking records from USAA related to Ghislaine Maxwell. It shows ongoing criminal investigation efforts by the Southern District of New York to obtain financial records in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of subpoena for banking records
persons.context: The email chain references a subpoena for her banking records from USAA as part of a criminal investigation, with her listed as the claimant.

events.title: USAA records request notification
events.description: ClaimFox sends a notification that the request for Ghislaine Maxwell's banking records from USAA has been received and is being prepared.

events.title: Email forwarding USAA subpoena update
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney forwards the December 24 notification about the USAA subpoena for Maxwell's records to colleagues, noting a delay due to vacation.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document shows an active criminal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's finances as of late 2019/early 2020.
The Southern District of New York issued a subpoena to USAA for Maxwell's banking records.
A third-party service, ClaimFox, was used to manage the records request process.
The communication highlights coordination among prosecutors regarding evidence gathering.
The email indicates the investigation was ongoing around the time of Maxwell's arrest (July 2020).
